title: Liverpool should fear wounded Manchester United, says Jurgen Klopp
text:
Jürgen Klopp, the Liverpool manager, believes Manchester United will be whipped into a fury by the air of ridicule surrounding the build-up to Sunday's Premier League meeting between the clubs.

Klopp said if his players were ever subjected to the criticism directed at Ole Gunnar Solskjaer and his team, he would be exploiting it as a powerful motivation tool.​

“In general, the mood that these things create? Yes, I would use it,” said Klopp, as he anticipated a backlash at Old Trafford.​

The Liverpool coach was particularly scathing of those who picked a combined XI from both sides and included no United players.​

“A joke,” Klopp said. “The world is a circus and we are at the centre of it. I saw all these things and it looks like they want to help Man United. ​

“All these articles look like they have been written by Man United supporters. ​
description: Jürgen Klopp, the Liverpool manager, believes Manchester United will be whipped into a fury by the air of ridicule surrounding the build-up to Sunday's Premier League meeting between the clubs.
